page.title: 16MEMORIES OF WOOKEY HOLE (2)
page.content: AT ONE TIME, WOOKEY HOLE HAD ITS OWN PARK, AS A PIECE OF LAND WAS GIVEN BY THE MILL OWNER IN CELEBRATION OF THE KING GEORGE V1 CORORATION. UNHAPPILY, THE LAND REVERTED TO ITS FORMER OWNER ON HIS DEATH, AND THERE HAD BEEN PROBLEMS OVER THE VOLUNTARY UPKEEP OF CORONATION PARK BY THE VILLAGERS. ONE ELDERLY RESIDENT CONSIDERS THAT THE GREATEST CHANGE OVER THE YEARS HAS BEEN THE REDUCTION OF ACTIVITIES IN WOOKEY HOLE AREA, WHICH USED TO SUPPORT ITS OWN CHOIR, FOOTBALL TEAM AND CHILDREN AT THE SCHOOL FROM LARGE FAMILIES OF THE TIME. SHE WELL REMEMBERS CORONATION DAY,12th MAY 1937, WHEN HER HOUSE WAS GAILY DECORATED WITH FLAGS AND BUNTING, AND A THANKSGIVING SERVICE, CHILDRENS' SPORTS,TEA PARTY AND A GRAND SOCIAL IN THE EVENING AT THE VILLAGE CLUB.
